column6: you’ve got to go back to move forward. I recently stumbled accross this old video of myself and my good friend Matt Da Cruz from 3 years ago discussing the future of some of the sickest SEO tools ever released for public consumption.

autoload: 0\">

option_id: This was the precursor to some of the features we had planned for the WP Ultimate Theme and features that they were building into their suite of tools for Domain Web Studio.

option_name: I get excited for two reasons (1) I still had my dreadlocks which I later cut in 2012 (big mistake after 21 years of committment) and (2) the sinister advanced SEO brain storm sessions with Matt plotting market-domination over some highly-caffeinated coffee hit truly unchartered depths.
we could spend the next 10 years building out the tip of the iceberg for some of the automated tools we discussed
option_value: but I digress.

option_id: Looking back in hindsight reminds me that it’s a good idea to evaluate and assess your old strategies
option_name: progress and lessons learned along the way (essentially knowing where you have been
option_value: to define where you’re going).

option_id: While many of the proposed modules we discussed on the video then have changed (such is life)
option_name: other ideas have evolved and taken their place in existing features in either their software or ours.

we have some great updates underway for SEO Ultimate’s Opengraph Integrator module and are looking forward to updating other SEO Ultimate features for the sake of enhanced usability… But what about our WP Ultimate theme?

option_id: Update on The WP Ultimate Theme Release

option_name: you’ll never have a <em>second chance to make a first impression
option_value: which is why we’ve been so stringent about not releasing our beta version of WP Ultimate Theme until each feature is checked
autoload: double checked and triple checked under a diverse array of use-case scenarios.

option_id: To whet your beak in anticipation of the release
option_name: we’ve provided a few sneak-peak screen caps below for you to peruse.

option_id: The Layout settings feature allows fixed
option_name: fluid or responsive layout options and customizable sidebar and/or content width.

option_id: The Typography and Style Settings allow granularly CSS / Design control w/ color picker and straight-forward controls.
The Ad Manager Module allows you to add HTML scripts or upload banners with ease and ads can also be used as short codes.
The Short Code Generator Module allows you to create and use your own short codes (maps
option_name: contact forms
option_value: HTML or text) or
autoload: you can select from our built-in short codes from content boxes to columns (it’s in there).

option_name: affiliates and small business owners seeking a visually stunning SEO equalizer will soon have some new SEO and Design tools to play with.
in the meantime
option_value: we are currently stress-testing and refining the last batch of newly integrated features in the front-end (e.g. Twitter Bootstrap
column5: Slider Revolution
column6: a Timed Lightbox Feature
column9: the quick silo builder and an ever-increasing library of shortcodes).

option_name: It’s a Wrap

option_id: Our beta testers are now in their final review
option_name: so
option_value: once all bugs are crushed
autoload: we’ll broadcast the announcement to those of you reading this blog via the proper social channels and you’ll be able to download your copy and put it to the test. As always
column5: we look forward to your feedback and suggestions on how we can make our tools the best they can be.

option_id: The jury on price point is still hung as we have poured our heart
option_name: soul and most coveted tactics and tools into this framework
option_value: but we’ll be sure to enticeearly adopters with a special promotion coupon code for the launch before settling at the final single user license fee and extended / unlimited site user license rates.

option_name: thank you for your patience during the scope-creep cycles we’re emerging from. We truly look forward to building a dynamic community and providing useful resources that you can deploy powered by our battle-tested SEO strategies and tools to generate more revenue for your business.

feel free to download SEO Ultimate our All-In-One WordPress SEO Plugin and take a peak at the video tutorial explaining how to use its various features. Thanks again and stay tuned for more SEO goodies.

Do internal links pass more referential integrity for the topic of your pages and where they fit in to your website’s architecture to search engines than links from other websites? Let’s investigate in today’s post.

option_id: Why Internal Links Matter More than Backlinks
To start with a mental image and analogy
option_name: think of internal links like veins in your website analogous SEO circulatory system. Their role and function are equally as important to the health of your website as the veins are to your body.

option_id: Think of each page as an island in itself
option_name: the page essentially has 3 attributes and/or characteristics (1) the links to it from other pages (2) the content or topic of the page and (3) the links leaving the page.

option_id: Based on those three characteristics each page serves a very specific function in the website. That function is either (1) to rank as a champion page / preferred landing page or (2) to serve as a hub page / supporting page (to create enough topical relevance) to rank preferred landing pages.
Continue reading >>> Why Internal Links are More Important than Backlinks Here!

You’ve heard of duplicate content
column8: but how do you know if you are creating it or how to stop it from penalizing your website? If you have a WordPress site
column10: but for the sake of elaboration
column11: let’s delve deeper into how search engines work and reveal what duplicate content really is.

option_id: Block segment analysis dictates the value of weight / ranking factors a web page is given for a set portion of the page. For example
option_name: text in the header and footer of a document are treated differently than the text in the body section of a page.

option_id: The header is given more weight than the footer and typically the body text is given more value than both (since that is where the page has the ability to distinguish itself from borrowed elements
option_name: i.e. navigation
option_value: etc.).

option_name: page composition dictates that proximity and distinction (the more unique one document is from another) by distinguishing your content
option_value: the better. Search engines can easily discern duplication (through shingle analysis
column5: etc.) in areas such as <a href=\"http://www.seodesignsolutions.com/blog/seo-videos/google-website-analysis-live-site-review/\">navigation
column6: sidebars/blogrolls with the same links and footers all using the same text. This has the tendency of diffuse a pages ranking potential.

option_name: 19 Feb 2013 21:46:06 PST\";s:7:\"attribs\";a:0:{}s:8:\"xml_base\";s:0:\"\";s:17:\"xml_base_explicit\";b:0;s:8:\"xml_lang\";s:0:\"\";}}s:4:\"guid\";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:\"data\";s:46:\"http://www.seodesignsolutions.com/blog/?p=9219\";s:7:\"attribs\";a:1:{s:0:\"\";a:1:{s:11:\"isPermaLink\";s:5:\"false\";}}s:8:\"xml_base\";s:0:\"\";s:17:\"xml_base_explicit\";b:0;s:8:\"xml_lang\";s:0:\"\";}}s:11:\"description\";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:\"data\";s:373:\"Its no secret that WordPress is one of the most popular
option_value: easy-to-implement content management systems online. But just because its easy doesnt mean that the out-of-the-box WordPress settings are ideal for optimal on page SEO. In fact

Its no secret that WordPress is one of the most popular
column6: easy-to-implement content management systems online. But just because its easy doesnt mean that the out-of-the-box WordPress settings are ideal for optimal on page SEO. In fact
column7: there’s nothing farther from the truth.

option_id: How to Block Bots for Optimal SEO

option_name: we cover simple solutions to prevent redundant pages (pages with duplicate or minimal content) from getting indexed from the rovingtarsus of search engine spiders.

option_id: Search engines use a bag of words model to deduce market-focus (what each page is about) and topicality and relevancy are often lost when boilerplate templates
option_name: category pages
option_value: tags or archives pages are left wide-open for spiders to crawl.

option_name: youll bolster your websites relevancy by having a higher percentage of unique indexed content.

option_id: While users might observe a tag page
option_name: a search engine is programmed to view that page as redundant content with very few classifiers to distinguish itself from the boilerplate template.
this is one of the prime directives of the Google Panda algorithm (to eliminate low quality content through normalization within a body of documents) hence
option_value: pages like these often get ignored or suppressed.

option_id: Websites with a high percentage of duplicate or minimal content on pages (such as category
option_name: archives or tag pages) can trigger algorithmic suppression.

option_id: If your an avid SEO and understand HTML then you could simply implement a meta-robots command such as nofollow or noindex
option_name: but unless you want to do that painstakingly page by page
option_value: youll need a plugin such as SEO Ultimate (The Premiere All-In-One WordPress SEO Plugin) from SEO Design Solutions that allows you to quickly and easily implement control over robots (search engine spiders) and canonicalization on the fly.

option_id: If you are already using SEO Ultimate
option_name: chances are you have already implemented these changes. If not
option_value: then lets get started by making your website canonical and segmenting any potential duplicate content penalties. This is particularly important to new websites so they can make a great first impression (by preventing non-canonical taxonomies or duplicate content from being indexed).

option_name: Panda and the other zoo animals running amuck) you’ll need to avoid tripping any algorithmic filters. Sharing content across multiple pages or thin content on boilerplate templates can devalue the integrity of your website architecture and spring these booby traps into action.

option_id: A splintering effect occurs dynamically by default when using WordPress. For example
option_name: when you create a post
option_value: that post also gets added to a category archive and if you use tags
autoload: then each tag also becomes a page with a link via the excerpt to the original post.

option_name: selective indexation via the Meta Robot Editor module is an ideal countermeasure to prevent multiple pages from being indexed and potentially creating penalties. Keep in mind
option_value: if its not indexed
autoload: there is no penalty (which is the basis of the Meta Robot Editor).

option_id: Example of Category Archive Page with Cyclical Posts Under Category

option_name: tag pages are not ideal landing pages
option_value: which is why canonicalization is important. You want the search engines to show them the original page or post (not some tag or category archive).

option_id: Search engines have been known to suppress websites which allow tag pages and category archives to leach through into their index by relegating them to the supplemental results.
First proceed to the SEO Ultimate module manager and make sure the Canonicalizer
option_name: Meta Robot Tags Editor module
option_value: Miscellaneous module and Nofollow Manager module are all enabled >>> then click the save changes button.

option_id: If you are wondering about what canonicalization is or why it matters
option_name: here’s a brief synopsis in layman’s terms.

option_id: What it does: Canonicalizer will point Google to the correct URL for your homepage and each of your posts
option_name: Pages
option_value: categories
column5: date archives
column6: and author archives.

option_id: Why it helps: If Google comes across an alternate URL by which one of those items can be accessed
option_name: it will be able to find the correct URL and wont penalize you for having two identical pages on your site.
click the Canonicalizer Module and under the Canonical URL Generation setting tick the first two boxes:

option_id: This will ensure that any potential splintering of pages or posts are redirected to the primary page (helping Google avoid any potential confusion about your website architecture or data hierarchy).

option_name: make sure you tick the redirect requests for nonexistent pagination checkbox to add an automated 301 redirect for categories or archives that have recently changed due to adding or deleting content within the category or archive.

option_id: Please Note: Canonicalizer improves on two WordPress features to minimize possible exact-content duplication penalties. The <link rel=\"canonical\" /> tags setting improves on the canonical tags feature of WordPress 2.9 and above by encompassing much more of your site than just your posts and Pages.
The nonexistent pagination redirect feature fills a gap in WordPresss built-in canonicalization functionality: for example
option_name: if a URL request is made for page 6 of a category archive
option_value: and that category doesnt have a page 6
column5: depending on the context
column6: WordPress will display a blank page
column7: or it will display the content of the closest page number available
column8: without issuing a 404 error or a 301 redirect (thus creating two or more identical webpages).

option_id: This duplicate-content situation can happen when you
option_name: for example
option_value: remove many posts from a category
autoload: thus reducing the amount of pagination needed in the categorys archive. The Canonicalizers feature fixes that behavior by issuing 301 redirects to page 1 of the paginated section in question.

option_id: Implementing the Nofollow and Meta Robot Tags Editor
Since you are already in the Miscellaneous Module scroll down until you see the Nofollow Manager module>>> Click All the Boxes and save changes and your done with this step.
The Nofollow Manager module lets you set the nofollow attribute on entire swaths of links on your site. Although Google has deprecated the use of nofollow for PageRank Sculpting in 2008
option_name: if youre transitioning from another SEO plugin to SEO Ultimate
option_value: Nofollow Manager can help you maintain your existing settings if youd rather take an if it aint broke dont fix it approach.

option_id: Regardless of whether or not you elect to use the Nofollow Manager module as an on page SEO tactic
option_name: you can implement the Meta Robot Tags Editor as a catch-all solution.
pages

Control default settings

column5: etc. listed above.

option_name: you have the ability to granularly assign index or noindex or nofollow status to pages
option_value: posts
column5: tags and post format archives (through either using the default settings or individually). Once default values are assigned
column6: they will carry through to the other sections e.g. categories
column8: etc. unless you specify and overwrite the option by visiting the tabs specific to each type.

option_id: For a more detailed explaination of all the SEO Ultimate modules feel free to watch the video here.

option_name: there is one more thing we suggest in the Settings>>>Permalinks>>> and changing from the default parameter to custom and using /%category%/%postname%/ to create keyword-rich URL structure instead of the default URL output. This will give you more bang for your buck by creating keyword rich URL structures instead of the default P=ID# setting that WordPress generates by default.
well discuss how to use the SEO Ultimate Siloed Categories Widget in tandem with the Deeplink Juggernaut Module to quickly implement website silo architecture quickly and easily on your blog.

SEO Ultimate
autoload: (the All-In-One WordPress SEO plugin created by SEO Design Solutions) was recently updated to version 7.6.1 and introduced an exciting new feature for the Deeplink Juggernaut module that allows you to dampen the amount of internal links either globally or on a keyword by keyword basis.

option_id: SEO Ultimate 7.6.1 Introduces Autolink Dampening Feature
Without going into wild-eyed speculation about Google Penguin and Panda algorithms and / or how other search engines determine what is considered natural or unnatural
option_name: the correlation between excessive link quantities and spam (for either inbound links from other websites or even internal links within websites) is a sensitive
option_value: yet serious issue for SEO.

option_name: we do know that if you push it too far with either excessive inbound or internal links that your hard earned SERP (search engine result page) position could potentially trigger a penalty and recede (either partially or entirely from the index).
we previously implemented a site cap feature for Deeplink juggernaut module which allowed you to prescribe a link cap for internal links to prevent potential over optimization penalties.

option_id: This feature (previously known as the per link customization feature) was originally created to provide webmasters with fine-grained control over their automated internal links within their website.

option_name: say you had a large site and assigned an autolink / keyword to a specific URL like linking the word electronics to your electronics category landing page
option_value: but you used this phrase egregiously on several thousand instances in your website.

option_id: The last thing you would want is for every instance of that keyword (shingle) to link to the target URL and trip a filter for over optimization. Hence
option_name: we created two methods to limit this scenario.

option_id: The first link governor is located in the quantity restrictions region of the content link settings tab of the Deeplink Juggernaut Module that allows you to limit the autolink functionality to one instance per page/post (or you can adjust the number of instances per page/post with this option)
option_name: but what about the rest of the website and those other potential instances of the keyword / autolink?
aside from limiting the number of times the keyword was used in the content
option_value: what could be done to limit over optimization with autolinking?

option_id: This was why we originally implemented a link cap via the per link customization feature for SEO Ultimate (on versions 6.5 to version 7.5.7) which allowed you to cap the links (and prevent additional instances of autolinking for each keyword) with a quantity based limit i.e. 15 times
option_name: 25 times
option_value: etc.

option_id: While this feature worked beautifully on the majority of websites
option_name: in some server environments the per link customization site cap feature was rather intensive and created problems due to memory allocation and the inability to turn up the memory within shared hosting environments. So
option_value: now the module has evolved and been rewritten using a distinctly different approach we called link dampening.

option_id: The Link Dampening feature allows you dampen the number of total links for internal link quantities for keywords assigned in the content link settings module of SEO Ultimate.
If the anchor text you specify occurs many times throughout your sites content
option_name: you may wish to reduce the overall frequency with which the anchor text is hyperlinked. You can reduce the autolinking frequency by a percentage with the Dampener field. For example:

option_id: • 50% dampening means the anchor text will be autolinked approximately half as often as it otherwise would be.
• 90% dampening means the anchor text will be autolinked only 10% as often as it otherwise would be.
• 100% dampening means the anchor text wont be linked at all.
The Dampener column will only appear if youve enabled it under the Content Link Settings tab.

option_name: navigate to the Deeplink Juggernaut content links setting tab and click the option [x] globally decrease autolinking frequency by x%
option_value: then
autoload: add your percentage for global link dampening (using the appropirate ratio above).

option_name: you can use the next checkbox down [x] Add a dampener column to the content links editor (which allows you to dampen links on a per link quantity basis).

option_id: After activation of this setting
option_name: you can dampen link percentages on a keyword / per link basis.

option_id: We hope you enjoy and implement this useful SEO feature. This is merely one tactic you can employ using SEO Ultimate for automated internal linking to create optimal on page SEO. Come back soon as we release more informative SEO Ultimate tips and share techniques like how to silo your WordPress blog using the SEO Ultimate Siloed Categories Widget.

Its that time again to kick off the new year and what better way to do so than (1) a new update to - “The Real All-In-One SEO Plugin for WordPress” – SEO Ultimate and (2) to introduce (our long-awaited) comprehensive video tutorial covering each SEO Module in detail for our plugin.

option_id: Click to Watch the Long-Awaited SEO Ultimate Video Tutorial (Opt-In Required)

option_name: SEO Ultimate was NOT designed for the public; it was originally designed as an in-house SEO tool deployed specifically to provide unparalleled on page SEO setup for WordPress. By consolidating these features into modules (that we could simply toggle on or off and configure at will) allowed us to virtually dominate hundreds of markets for our clients (without having to painstakingly customize the code time and time again).

option_id: Why All the Secrecy with SEO Ultimate?
Many wondered – if SEO Ultimate is so awesome
option_name: then why not show us how to use this thing? Well
option_value: frankly
column5: then we didn’t want to create unnecessary competition in our markets
column6: especially from giving away our most cherished methods free of charge.

option_id: We hope this explains the lack of documentation over the years aside from version updates where we briefly informed users about new features
option_name: but in all honesty
option_value: we kept the real power of SEO Ultimate close to the chest – until now. The time has come to provide detailed documentation of each module
autoload: why it’s important and of course
column5: how to use it – courtesy of our lead developer John Lamansky.

option_name: we poured over 15 years of real world advanced SEO principles into this plugin. Prior to releasing this tutorial
option_value: the argument of just how powerful SEO Ultimate vs. any other SEO plugin may have been in question. However
column5: this should clear up any confusion about the depth or the real purpose behind each module and the scope of the plugin.

option_id: SEO Ultimate has amazing features such as:

option_name: Reviews and More)

option_id: • Automated Internal Linking (with New Link Dampening Feature)
<li>A Mass/Bulk Editor for Complete Editing for Meta Tags
option_name: Titles
option_value: Keywords
column5: Media Attachments
column6: Post Format Archives and much

option_id: While the deliberate suppression of information regarding the inner workings of the SEO Ultimate features was not entirely deliberate
option_name: there was a concurrent master plan in the works. Just think of it like a 6 year chess game where each move unfolds another strategic layer of the battle plan
option_value: only to culminate in a brilliant (market-dominating) end-game and check mate. It’s like that
autoload: but in this case its all about the WP Ultimate Framework.

option_id: The WP Ultimate Framework for WordPress

The market dominating check mate in this scenario was that our proprietary SEO platform (SEO Ultimate) was absorbed and integrated into our WordPress Framework to provide unparalled SEO & Design flexibility. The beauty for end-users is
option_name: once you gain access to the framework
option_value: you also get access to the training as well.

option_name: as many of you know for the past two years we’ve toiled away in the labs like obsessive compulsive perfectionists testing the WPU Framework and we’re nearly finished coding and stress-testing now. When complete
option_value: we will release 1000 copies to a select group
autoload: then take that feedback and roll even more powerful features into the Framework.

option_name: however
option_value: recent additions to the framework include adding Twitter Bootstrap
column5: a Lightbox Feature which can be toggled via a timer or  link)
column6: a more comprehensive Style Editor
column7: a New Media Manager suite to insert ads
column9: shortcodes and  more and a Completely Reworked Grid System to handle responsive layouts
column10: fluid layouts or the ability to create fixed width layouts to liberate your design impulse and display options and build websites that rank as great as they look.

option_id: Combine this with the robust SEO power of SEO Ultimate and you can see why we’re excited…

option_name: you can read a few of the WP Ultimate features
option_value: or stay tuned as we release more information on the launch details over the next few weeks.

option_name: so
option_value: do not be surprised from the opt-in form prior to accessing the video tutorial. The video is over one hour long and jam-packed with EVERYTHING you’ll need to get the most our of SEO Ultimate.

option_name: keep in mind
option_value: we intend on putting other advanced training videos and tactics which will not be featured anywhere else in the members section. By opting-in
autoload: you’ll gain access to that material and will also be notified when we launch the WP Ultimate Framework.

option_id: We hate spam as much as you do and respect your privacy. You can opt out-at any time. This (content-locking) method simply helps us manage our user-base more efficiently and separate the power-users from the sheep.
Enter First Name and Email Address for Instant Access!
>>>Click Here to Watch the Official SEO Ultimate Video Tutorial<<<
We wish you the best in 2013 and look forward to providing the best

Keywords are the cornerstone of any online conversation. Metrics such as user engagement
column5: conversion and search engine optimization all rely on critical keywords and their convergence to convey relevancy and intent to your audience. The question is
column6: how do you know which keywords are worth using and which are better to ignore?

In case you havent heard
column6: Google has released a new disavow links tool allowing you to disavow (deny the existence of) any questionable backlinks.

option_id: While the first thought that comes to mind is mission impossible if you are caught
option_name: the government will disavow your existence. Now
option_value: it seems that webmasters have the ability to do this with their links (if their mission fails).

option_id: On a brief comical Google conspiracy side note: now
option_name: the unnatural links warning broadcast email from Google this July makes perfect strategic sense.

option_id: Was this part of the plan all along
option_name: to scare webmasters with the notice then have them participate in the cleanup with the new link disavow tool (to further improve their algorithm) like a mass web-wide manual review using us as user generated base of motivated volunteers? Hmmm <fingers on chin in perplexed pondering gesture>
option_value: the world may never know.

option_name: so much for the Google conspiracy theories or movie trivia
option_value: so how does the tool work? After logging in
autoload: simply click the red button and then proceed to the browse / upload feature.

option_name: simply select the link location file (a .txt file with the URLs or domains in question) and upload it and thats it.
allow Google ample time to re-crawl the links (with Googlebot armed with the link abort list) and monitor the SERPs for signs of Penguin symptom- like recovery.

option_id: Google suggests not to disavow links from your own website
option_name: however aside from that
option_value: this is one way to get rid of pesky links which could be hurting your website in the SERPs (search engine result pages).

option_id: Since you cant control who links to you
option_name: this is a great way to unwind potential backlinks acquired from negative SEO via competitors or otherwise.
there are no guarantees that they will disavow any or all links found in the discovery from the uploaded file
option_value: but this tool is better than having no option at all and having to sit it out in the penalty box indefinitely (if your website has lost rankings or been penalized in some way as a result of bad link neighborhoods).

option_id: Consider yourself debriefed and good luck on your mission: Project SERP Recovery.

If youre a webmaster and have been impacted (penalized
column6: lost traffic or have been caught in an algorithmic filter) from Google
column7: the conclusion is obvious that Google isnt trying to win a popularity contests with their user base lately.

option_name: it was the dawn of the web shattering Panda update (a content classifier designed to remove low quality web pages
option_value: websites that copied from other websites or weak internal pages with minimal value) from their index
column5: the backlink witch hunt / Penguin update (designed to demote websites from ranking highly which have off-topic or inbound links from low quality websites) and now the EMD update (the exact match domain update) which demotes websites which have exact match domains from easily ranking for their core keywords.

option_id: While most savvy SEOs or online marketing types understand the lingo
option_name: for those unfamiliar with the terminology
option_value: exact match domains are websites such as babycribs.com which in the past would rank rather easily for the key phrase baby cribs.

option_id: Exact match domains are typically highly sought from Domaineers (individuals who purchase
option_name: collect
option_value: monetize or sell domains) due to their ability to (1) rank highly in search engines with a fraction of the effort by the virtue of the domain name or (2) monetize those sites due to the commercial viability (since consumers easily commit the domain name to memory); that is

option_name: there was a glaring loophole in search engines (Google in particular) which allowed exact match domains to rank uncontested with minimal SEO (sometimes within days of being created). So
option_value: instead of spending money on SEO
column5: businesses would often spend the money on acquiring a top level exact match domain.

option_name: a website in the #1 position for an organic search phrase can garner 42-70% of the click through traffic for a keyword (compared to 2% in the number 10 position on the page); and since 7 out of 10 people typically click the organic results instead of paid (PPC) results
option_value: this is a major blow if dethroned from the #1 position or top 3 organic positions on the page.

option_name: avid SEO personality Barry Schwartz from SEO Round Table gleaned a tidbit of relevant info on the EMD update. Apparently
option_value: in a recent tweet by Matt Cutts (head of Googles Web Spam Team) he states Minor weather report: small upcoming Google algo change will reduce low-quality “exact-match” domains in search results.

option_id: Cutts later tweeted New exact-match domain (EMD) algo affects 0.6% of English-US queries to a noticeable degree. Unrelated to Panda/Penguin.

option_name: 0.6 thats not so bad right? That all depends on the sheer volume of total English-US queries
option_value: and
column8: that represents 60 million potential queries affected daily by this change.

option_id: Theres nothing minor about this or any other algorithm
option_name: infrastructure or classifier change in a search engines index
option_value: more specifically
autoload: this is the equivalent of Hurricane Katrina to a small business or website not fortified by alternative traffic or citation sources.

option_id: While most webmasters may not own an EMD or rely strictly on the ranking power of an exact match domain alone; if you do own a full or partial hyphenated EMD and your websites major keywords disappear
option_name: your revenue is and business model are inevitably impacted instantly.
once rankings dip
option_value: your cash flow could tank or you could inevitably go out of business
autoload: unless you have a plan B for traffic (particularly in this economy).

option_id: Based on the inquiries we have received for the past 6 months from companies in need of solutions to Google changes
option_name: most webmasters (business owners
option_value: individuals and affiliates alike)
autoload: do not have a plan B and are <strong>puzzled
column5: frustrated
column6: agitated or struggling to determine what happened to their traffic
column9: when things were just fine before the latest monkey wrench tweak. Was it a competitor throwing a batch of bad links from negative SEO
column10: or did they simply trip a filter and get hit with a penalty?

option_name: its dangerous for webmasters to blindly assume that once you attain a high ranking position for your primary keyword (exact match domain or otherwise) that your website wont be churned off the page (from an update
option_value: filter or algorithm change).

option_name: its not even your site being penalized; its the other sites that linked to yours that took the hit (and your website is no longer buoyant in the search results as a result). Keep in mind that when they purge their index many of the sites that were holding other sites up (by virtue of their citation/links) have been caught (essentially algorithmically neutered) from passing link flow to other websites.
if your website happened to receive sustenance from an algorithmically compromised website
option_value: then
column5: the link-flow dropped off. Essentially
column6: you start from zero again and fall to the back of the line (rolled back 5-10 pages in the search results) or sometimes worse (not ranking at all for the keyword).

option_name: there are no guarantees when it comes to how search engines tally links
option_value: popularity
column5: its merely their perception of what they think their users want. What Google forgets is
column6: its those same users who own websites and have become dependent on that traffic for their business who are getting thrown under the bus and have no idea why.

option_id: This process has gone on for years and quite frankly
option_name: people are getting tired of running the gauntlet and trying to appease their new rules (starting with things like adding nofollow attributes to all outbound links) because Google couldnt detect link intent i.e. paid links with their algorithm and wanted to impose using nofollow to webmasters to add nofollow attributes to all outbound links (using the fear of penalties) as a consequence.
Google just kept a plethora of updates coming (in the name or relevancy) from the Florida Update
option_value: the Big Daddy Update
column5: The Vince Update
column6: the Panda Update

option_id: Is SEO still important? Yes and No!
SEO is important if you have (1) implemented conversion optimization first
option_name: so that regardless of where your traffic emanates from
option_value: it will result in increased ROI (return on investment) via more subscriptions
autoload: social engagement (viral traffic) or sales and (2) If you have the budget and / or staff to afford implementing the often tedious work associated with SEO.

option_id: SEO is NOT important if want to spend more money on Television
option_name: Radio
option_value: Newspaper ads
column5: have a strong offline marketing push. While Google’s claim for making these changes is relevancy
column6: their motivation has transcended “building the best search engine” and has become something far more transparent (scrub compromise the organic search results and focus on paid search which provides approximately 98% of all profits for Google).

option_name: a large portion of the SEO process is based on developing sufficient website authority through exceeding the algorithmic tipping point for on page content (with the quality of that content now being equally as important as the volume and frequency).
since articles dont write themselves
option_value: youll need an in-house subject matter expert or a knowledgeable writer or team of writers if you intend on developing the authority site model. Instead of building and relying on backlinks
autoload: create content that is worthy to garner its own links or leverage the on page authority and trust your website has to catapult past less authoritative websites in your way.

option_name: developing authority is a lengthy process that requires commitment and dedication to quality and consistency (always providing users value instead of rehashing vague fodder). Also remember that nothing happens overnight with SEO (most sustainable results can take months)
option_value: in short
autoload: its all about planting and sowing the results over time.

option_name: people will share it (if you give them a nudge) and the social sharing has tremendous weight in the new algorithm (to expedite authority for the page and hence the site).

option_id: If you plan on using the three strategies outlined above
option_name: then SEO is important. Otherwise
option_value: you may have to seek alternative traffic sources to offset dependency on Googles organic traffic as a life vein for your business.

option_id: Is the epic battle of giants affecting your business?
Me Facebook Beat You Google
In this Bizarro world where Google wants to be more social and Facebook is talking about creating their own search engine
option_name: <em>be worried
option_value: be very worried since core competencies exist for a reason.

option_id: The rise and fall of search results for webmasters may result in a requiem for search engines
option_name: since consumers can easily jump ship and find the next big thing and find new ways to get what they want.

option_id: Lets just say that backlash is an understatement and when the search bubble bursts (and it will)
option_name: I wouldnt want to be in aisle 5 (if you catch my drift). Im sure Myspace
option_value: Digg and other once popular websites never saw it coming as they were displaced by a fickle (or bored) user base or lots of savvy emerging competitors who introduced something equally viable to woo their users away. The end result
autoload: their traffic sources (repeat visitors) dried up (like dust in the wind).

option_id: While search does not exclusively belong to Google
option_name: quality matters and the importance and credibility of organic results is what delivers the most traffic from repeat visitors.
the site loses its value. In my opinion
option_value: that is how I view Googles search results
column5: they have filtered so many things that good sites along with the bad have been suppressed (which translates to a poor user experience). I find myself having to refine my searches more and more
column6: since the results on the first page are NOT what I am looking for and often are so far off topic I am amazed how it surfaced.

option_id: Don’t Let Bad Search Happen to You!

option_name: not to go all fist of goodness on you here (props to direct TV vs. cable ads) but
option_value: this is one thing for both Google and users alike to keep in mind.

option_name: the less people search
option_value: the less people search
autoload: the less valuable the paid ads become
column5: the less valuable the paid ads become the more a search engine tries to justify its position to those paying for ads
column6: the more a search engine tries to justify its position for those paying for ads
column8: penalties or adjustments are enforced through the index vs. the content in the index which affects its organic user base
column10: penalties or adjustments are made that affect the organic user base
column11: the less users will depend on search engines.

Rather than overreact to rankings alone and scream the sky is falling
column5: for the past 15 months we have been quietly testing new strategies that can withstand the likes of Panda (a quality control classifier) and Penguin (a thematic link sniffing filter) that demotes websites with excessive inbound anchor text i.e. unnatural link signals.

option_id: It's Not About Links
option_name: It's About Promotions

option_id: Keep in mind suspicious or contrived link signals could imply a wide variety of possibilities
option_name: such as:

option_id: • Unnatural link velocity (building or losing links too fast).

option_name: i.e. a high percentage of the same or similar anchor-text.

option_id: • Links from mixed-fruit / atypical websites that lack genuine/natural signals such as (1) supporting / thematic inbound links (2) traffic and engagement or (3) social signals (which is why many generic link networks failed to get past Penguin).
It’s no secret that two Google algorithm changes (Penguin and Panda) nearly eradicated SEO as we knew it
option_name: however
option_value: one thing is certain about SEO
autoload: the fact that it’s always adapting or in a state of flux.

option_id: Adaptation in this instance implies (a) understanding the entire keyword climate for all educational or promotional key phrases that consumers are using while progressing through the sales cycle (b) using that language strategically in titles
option_name: on page content
option_value: in your promotions (content
autoload: images and links) and (c) in the social graph as hooks that all drive traffic back to your branded promotional properties or your primary website. Expanding this process systemically facilitates perpetual conversions.

option_id: Is SEO Dead As We Know It?
Have the rules changed? Absolutely! Is SEO dead? In its previous embodiment
option_name: to a large extent
option_value: yes! So
autoload: the bottom line is (1) what now? And (2) how do I broadcast my brand and my message instead of merely churning mediocre content or fiddling with low quality backlinks?

option_id: Watch the videos below and learn how to quickly create your own thematically relevant personal broadcast network using WordPress
option_name: DWS and our plugin amply named The Silo Blog Builder. Afterwards
option_value: make sure to watch the webinar (further down the page) for an in depth overview of the new DWS 4.0 online promotion paradigm.

autoload: 0\">

option_name: if your primary website lacks traffic or sales
option_value: then no amount of outdated SEO (circa. the Google Penguin update April 2012) will make a difference. Its not just about rankings; its about how scalable your traffic sources are and how adept you are in extracting relevant traffic on demand.

option_id: Do mixed-fruit blog networks still work? No! or at least until a filter weeds them out. However
option_name: theme relevant networks still pass ranking factor (and can serve as a branded broadcast beacon for extended promotions)
option_value: which means a link from site B to site A must be theme relevant (have the same topic) and use the appropriate anchor text along with related synonyms (a.k.a. the DNA Braid) to avoid overoptimization filters or being smacked / deindexed.

option_name: it also helps to create stellar content (worthy of social media) and syndicate that content (to build links to your links) and ensure the longevity of your “broadcast channel”.

option_id: The new paradigm suggests to look past rankings and think of each site or promotional property as a beacon
option_name: broadcasting YOU (your brand)
option_value: All the Time

option_name: Its About Promotions!
using obsolete legacy metrics (such as search engine rankings and only using one website to compete) is defunct as a viable strategy.

option_id: The imperative metrics to consider are (1) how scalable are your personal broadcast networks? and (2) how theme relevant and extensive are your syndication sequences for generating traffic which is the only metric that matters.
Learn how to create a proper promotional campaign
option_name: including:

option_id: • how much those keywords are worth to your business
• how long it will take to get ranked
• how to use website silo architecture to build your website

option_name: synonyms and type of promotions you need to drive traffic
RSS directories
option_value: video sites or press release

option_id: sources to use and having a project management suite to coordinate your team.
Take The Next Step: Watch the DWS 4.0 Webinar!

option_name: on page SEO is still important
option_value: however quality content and engagement is a metric you simply cant afford to overlook
autoload: and about that off page SEO thing
column5: yeah
column6: over optimization is real

option_id: People Hemmed up in Panda and Penguin Algorithms Typically:
<li>Got a bit too greedy with off page SEO (link metrics) and churned out as much content to build links as possible (without thinking of quality).As a result
option_name: Google struck back with their quality control algorithms which comprised stricter filters
option_value: classifiers and relevance signals
column5: engagement time
column6: bounce rate
column7: thematic relevance of the link graph for the target and refering site) and 200 other fancy smancy words that translate to if your website sucks
column8: then good luck finding it in their SERPs”).

option_id: • People hemmed up in the Panda / Penguin Algo had a tendency to get a bit too lose with quality control on their promotional content and found out that regardless of the traffic source you MUST have something useful to contribute.Otherwise
option_name: your content will simply be skimmed over for something useful and ignored vs. starting with a solid foundation of engaging contnent and promotional content to begin with.

option_id: • Websites drastically afftected by Panda or Penguin often relied too heavily on one metric (such as links) because it was working and thus became complacent in regard to seeking viable alternatives or finding new ways to reach their ideal consumer.

option_name: Google is merely one traffic source; a very popular one
option_value: but not every consumer uses or purchases exclusively through their link/traffic/ sales funnel. This means
autoload: there are a myriad of alternate traffic funnels that you can leverage systematically to reach your audience contextually
column5: socially or otherwise.

option_id: A consumers impulse to purchase is either active or dormant
option_name: yet if that dormant spark of desire is enlivened through curiosity
option_value: a clever headline
column5: then conversion is merely a few clicks away. Conversions (making a sale) is not exclusive to Google
column6: in fact
column7: conversions can occur from a multitude of sources.

option_name: a conversion could occur from:

option_id: • playing a game online and being lured by an enticing banner
• during social interactions on Facebook (or other social platforms) from banners or contextual links
being lured from teaser check this out social media content or images in their various clever iterations
• from reading articles and clicking the contextual links (after social proof is established).

option_name: setting up the sales funnel should not be left to happenstance alone. In fact
option_value: when we map this phase of a campaign for a new client
autoload: we use what Russell Wright brilliantly coined as the IS-DNA. The letter “I” in “IS-DNA” stands for Invention/Innovation/Industry and the “S” stands for “Solution”.

option_id: Understanding Promotion as a Stackable Process
When we speak of “DNA” in our material we simply mean “components of” or “building blocks of”.
So “IS-DNA” translates into the “building blocks” of your innovation or invention that you have provided to your industry.

The purpose of the IS-DNA process is to align your market’s FAQs (frequently asked questions) with your market’s SAQ’s (should ask questions) by drilling down and getting to “the questions behind the questions”
option_name: or “the pain behind the questions” which will be used later to create highly converting articles and videos using the PAM (painkiller article method).

option_id: Remember that we are giving you a highly profitable stack-able business process
option_name: and the IS-DNA may very well be the most important part of the entire process
option_value: because it is the BASE of your PLMM (Perpetual Lead Magnet Machine) System and Pyramid. Get this wrong and you may end up using the wrong language to talk to the wrong market!

option_id: The IS-DNA set’s the stage by creating a matrix of market questions in order to help you select the most effective language that can reach your target market because you (and your team) will truly understand the problems and pains that have been solved for them by your product or service (innovation or invention).
Once you have mapped out the pain in the market
option_name: you can tactfully craft pain killers (PDF Download) in your content
option_value: videos
autoload: social media and/or promotions to transcend traffic-dependency (such as Google) to devour your entire market. To thrive
column5: youll have to escape the grasp of one simple traffic funnel to flourish.

option_id: Whenever you rely solely on a for profit business
option_name: that business (potentially) has the ability to endanger your bottom line. Just as the eggs in one basket adage comes to mind
option_value: the question is
autoload: are you still in Googles pocket? Or have you considered a long-term contingent strategy diverse enough to flourish (if Google or your most lucrative traffic source simply stopped providing traffic?).

option_id: To avoid putting your business at risk you must hedge your primary property with branded social media and third-party websites (just in case). Consider Googles last algorithm change Penguin. Many who were unprepared suffered
option_name: as their once profitable websites spigot of traffic got shut off
option_value: forcing them to find alternatives – rather than diverisfying and being prepared (as if Google never existed) in the first place.

option_name: you must change the way you think
option_value: which means instead of thinking about backlinks and on page optimization
autoload: replace on page SEO with genuinely engaging content and replace backlinks with the idea of broadcasts and promotions and broadcasting your brand (across hundreds of traffic-bearing sources) using a stackable / repeatable process that YOU control.

option_name: backlinks are merely a byproduct of promotions if you dont have anything worthy of sending traffic to
option_value: then visitors will simply bounce in search of better content; so
autoload: there is no need to put the cart before the horse.

option_id: Does Your Content Have a Clear Call to Action?

option_name: did you want to buy something? Ok
option_value: perhaps not this time right? It’s obvious that the image/message and timing doesn’t coinside as a strong call to action.

option_id: The point remains that regardless of the website a consumer is frequenting
option_name: conversion is merely a matter of enlivening synchronicity (between their needs and desires to your perfect solution via a product or service) to facilitate an impulse to purchase.

option_id: This fact was often overlooked entirely from SEO practitioners prior to Penguin who focused solely on fabricating lackluster content and flinging it in a thousand directions in an attempt to get links. Content farms thrived
option_name: comment spam
option_value: forum links and network sites were the rave.

option_name: most SEO practioners missed the boat from taking short cuts with their primary and promotional content. The notion that people would actually consume or be persuaded by fodder (lackluster content) and purchase is ridiculous. Dont make the same mistaketap the web
option_value: not just Google as a source of revenue.

option_id: Why Has Our Blog Been So Quiet for 3 Months?
In case you have wondered why the 3 month silence on the SEO Design Solutions Blog
option_name: On April 8th
option_value: I survived a horrific motorcycle crash avoiding a minivan that took my lane while I was riding my Ducati 996 at 90 MPH. It resulted in tumbling twisting and sliding nearly 900 feet on the Freeway (like a bowling ball).

option_name: I have multiple broken bones and some bumps and bruises (which are all healing now)
option_value: thankfully
autoload: I survived with no brain injury or spinal damage.

option_name: during the last 90 days
option_value: we have continued to make updates to SEO Ultimate The Real All-In One SEO Plugin and The WP Ultimate Theme our sleek
column5: WordPress Theme Framework (designed to give existing WordPress frameworks a run for their money).

option_name: later this month our lead developer John Lamansky plans to release an updated video for all the SEO Ultimate features from version .5 to present (which includes dozens of tips
option_value: updates and tweaks).

option_name: we will release our beta version of WP Ultimate for suggestions and tweaks for the final version. Until then
option_value: thank you for your patience and welcome to the new paradigm and its herald and summary its not about links

With millions of business owners
column5: webmasters and affiliates spending thousands of dollars on SEO and countless hours optimizing their websites (only to have the Google organic search results shaken up or completely whisked away due to vacillating shifts from new algorithm changes) is genuinely creating feelings of anger
column6: frustration and disdain.

option_id: Googles greatest fear is you not using or needing to use Google…
As if running a business wasn’t hard enough
option_name: business owners are now forced to deal with the rise and fall of search engine results (knowing that at any time aside from ruthless competitors targeting their most coveted positions that a new algorithm change could come along and potentially sweep all their progress under the rug) without warning.

option_id: The only solution is to either (1) conform or (2) diversify your traffic sources to become less dependent on any one source of visitors
option_name: however
option_value: most are either unwilling or unaware of their options
autoload: so they continue to run on the treadmill in hope of stability.

option_id: For large or small businesses alike faced with overhead
option_name: cash flow and competition; conforming or overly depending on any one traffic source (Google) is not a viable solution for creating long-term stability.

option_id: Faced with violent shifts in rankings and either posting record profits or losses based on where you rank is a type of traffic-dependency. That dependency can be weaned and replaced if those same business owners took their searches or paid search budget to other viable search engines and / or traffic sources to funnel traffic.

option_name: its time to see things for what they really are; the fact that Google (not surprisingly) is a business model motivated by profits. Despite the dont be evil motto which once brandished a blind eye from most
option_value: with recent allegations of privacy concerns
autoload: changes in Adwords policies (which left thousands banned with no explanation) and the constant organic search algorithm shuffle
column5: at some point users will come to terms with this and act accordingly (and ignore Google).

option_id: Recently Google informed untold numbers of webmasters that they were in violation of their terms of service for unnatural link activity. Needless to say
option_name: the fear of loss is a great motivator. When people are told to conform
option_value: most will to avoid going against the current of the status quo.

option_name: the audacity that webmasters should conform to a terms of service (considering they didn’t opt in in the first place) based on Google’s limitation on determining the value of the link graph (paid link
option_value: intentional link
column5: etc.) is preposterous. It’s not like anyone in their index ever received a request asking if it was OK to crawl your content and include it in their index?

option_name: New York Times
option_value: USA today or other massive authority sites add rel=nofollow tags to every outbound link or risk getting deindexed? No
autoload: they do not Then why should you have to?

option_id: The fact is that websites with that extent of authority simply dont need Google (because they already have an established brand) and users will go directly to their website instead of using Google as an intermediary (which is essentially all they are).
And how relevant would Google be if a user typed in CNN in Google and couldnt find CNN (or any large brand for that matter)
option_name: which makes brands essentially immune to being banned from their search results.
for small businesses
option_value: entrepreneurs
autoload: affiliates and others forced to compete daily in search engines to funnel traffic to thrive and survive are constantly pummeled by the vague terms of service which essentially means you cannot promote your website (unless its done according to Googles promotional policy).

option_name: the last time I checked links were not exclusively designed to manipulate PageRank
option_value: links are just links
autoload: the are simply how people move from page to page and website to website. Just as freedom of speech exists
column5: the freedom to link to who you like when you like exists in the same vein.

option_id: The only difference (mind you) is intent and links are either designed to deliver visitors from Page A to Page B or to promote its that simple. And people are going to promote their business by necessity in order to create a profit so
option_name: I dont see links going away any time soon
option_value: so
autoload: Google you will simply have to adapt (and stop penalizing webmasters) or they will simply move on to other traffic funnels.

option_name: if Google were losing money due to their massive operation
option_value: do you think they would have the time
autoload: energy or resources to keep shaking things up in the organic search results in the name of search quality?

option_id: Would they have time to ban countless advertisers (since they collectively are not worth the time to service compared to fortune 500 and up clientele)? I think not.
Is Google’ Greatest Fear Competition or Complacency?
With Facebook (the social giant) and Apple (the mobile giant) both considering entering the search engine space
option_name: Google could potentially have some SERIOUS competition ahead (unlike Yahoo or Bing) and which suggests that

option_id: 1) They will become obsolete as the preferred organic search engine and lose their monopoly (and profit).
2) Paid search will fail to deliver (since organic search is no longer the cats meow for disgruntled users) and the organic traffic base will diminish.
3) The curve will change (which is the most likely) meaning that new technologies
option_name: platforms
option_value: methods and/or solutions will emerge and people will simply move on from typing keywords in to search engines and use alternative methods such as apps
autoload: HTML5 or other alternatives to have media or commerce delivered on demand.

option_name: to directories
option_value: to search engines) followed by user adaptation which now borders on user complacency has already reached the point of consolidation.

option_id: This implies that the cycle is ripe for change and a new potential curve (such as Apples Siri) or other alternatives to search could make the previous achievement obsolete (e.g. pagers
option_name: cassette tapes
option_value: VCRs

option_name: at the time (back in the day) few were looking past the phase of user complacency and would still be using Pagers
option_value: cassette tapes
column5: etc. if new innovations and curves had not usurped them
column6: now making them obsolete.

option_id: While most people didnt know (or care) what a search engine was 10 years ago
option_name: fast forward 10 years and they may not even be able to remember.
the market is fickle and here today gone tomorrow can happen faster with the acceleration of communication and new emerging technologies.

option_id: 1) The very data in Google’s index that they attempt to police and enforce does not belong to them
option_name: it belongs to those who wrote it and who are generously sharing it with the web at large. Google does not create the content their index
option_value: “YOU and others like you DO” and how you promote it is up to you.

option_id: 2) The web is bigger than Google and you decide Googles fate every time you search on their platform or choose another search engine you cast your vote. There are thousands of traffic funnels to drive visitors to your websites aside from search engines (investigate them for viability to your business).

3) Google telling people to jump through hoops (in fear of a ranking penalty or removal from their index) is a Pandoras Box they should leave behind (or they might be left behind on the next emerging curve from those same banned/penalized users).

option_name: Googles greatest fear is you not using them and while their business model is brilliant
option_value: they’re the most successful company in history to profit from (1) using content created from other websites via crawling and indexing technology (2) create a synergistic advertising model as an accessory to their organic search results and (3) getting paid to send traffic away from their own site as an authoritative intermediary this curve
column5: has its limitations
column6: particularly
column7: if any of the aforementioned metrics change
column8: (such as Google having to ask permission to crawl your data).

option_name: we know that consumers are fickle and at any time they could opt-out and frequent other websites which have more emotional
option_value: functional or curb appeal than Google. Google started as one website and can potentially be reduced to that if people choose not to use it.

option_name: the users hold the key to just how much power or control you wish to allow it to have over you or your business.

option_id: Feel free to share your thoughts below

Just like degusting a fine wine to appreciate its full-bodied flavor
column6: don’t omit the chronology that its the process of the grapes aging combined with a semblance of subordinate processes that merge a plethora of complex layers into simplified notes to cultivate a delectable
column7: yet exquisite fine wine. In parallel

option_id: Like a fine wine
option_name: authority occurs over time

option_id: While most blindly assume that SEO is about keywords (which is partially true)
option_name: real SEO is involves grasping the underlying metrics and logic that search engines use to determine which websites are authoritative and which others are not.

option_id: The real goal of SEO is to create authority; and the faster you accomplish domain or page level authority for any website
option_name: the faster keyword conquests are realized and achieved. The extent of the authority of a website
option_value: determines how long (or short) a keyword conquest becomes.

option_id: If your website has exceeded the necessary tipping point (meaning it has enough term weight
option_name: link-flow from supporting anchor text and pages) and nests the proper on page signals
option_value: then that website is a candidate for occupying the top 1000 seed pages in Googles index otherwise dubbed “the authority set“. In essence
autoload: the more weight the pages have
column5: the more pages from that domain can be included as seeds in the organic search landscape.

option_name: only the top 1000 matter and from those 1000 pages there are typically a handful of domains which are considered dominant within the scope of that topic.

option_id: Those websites are considered the authority set and once any page from any website has reached the apex of a topic and breaches the authority set
option_name: it now becomes the model that Google and other search engines compare other pages to (to ascertain relevance
option_value: validity and rankings).

option_id: Your objective is to (a) model your data (b) site architecture (c) internal linking structures (d) backlinks and (e) navigation schema to reinforce the topical scope of a page for (1) the primary phrase (2) parallel themes or categories (3) synonyms and sibling themes and (4) adjacent pages which could benefit from the link-flow or page level / theme /authority of that page.
This in turn allows you to funnel PageRank
option_name: trust and authority to any area of your website with the ideal anchor text (at will) which makes your website less dependent on off-site linking structures to achieve buoyant ranking factor.
we have built websites using this technique and created PR5 sites from brand new domain (which achieved first page results in 30-45 days time for competitive keywords up to 7
autoload: 000 competing pages using less than 50 backlinks off-site.

option_name: the 70+ of the 95 internal pages also sprouted page rank (PR3
option_value: PR4 and PR5) which in turn funneled that ranking factor to other select pages creating an unparalleled tipping point like a tube Taurus folding in on itself) to propel even more rankings as a result
autoload: which leads to my next point.

option_id: Rankings can be observed from two perspectives (similar to the haves and have nots) and while the ultimate goal or optimizing your website stems from the desire to reach the top 3 spots (the traffic band) getting there is ultimately determined by how authoritative your page is and the website that supports it.
Every page of your website (if optimal) represents an opportunity to rank that page and dozens more when combined with SEO best practices
option_name: such as:

option_id: • A mirrored keyword-rich URL structure for the primary market and semantic focus of the page.
• Proper H1 use to reflect the primary keyword
• Sufficient inclusion of theme relevant keywords for the primary and secondary keyword shingles (groups of words).
• Awareness of link-flow limitations (not having 100+links on a page via navigation and contextual areas to bleed ranking factor).

• Proper site architecture that reflects a natural data hierarchy (with more competitive keywords higher up in the hierarchy and less competitive categories and mid-tail and long-tail keyword variations supporting the theme).

• The proper proportion of themed inbound links from qualified sources to the home page and deep links to various supporting categories and landing pages (with their primary shingles and / or synonyms).

option_name: cultivation of authority is the goal of SEO. Once that authority has been realized
option_value: it must be leveraged to propel entire clusters of keywords into a prominent search engine position (with minimal backlinks) from using the overlapping nodes of relevance and page level trust and relevance score it has accumulated.

option_id: The extent of the authority depends on (a) the freshness and introduction of new / supporting content (b) the volume of content (c) the age of the domain (d) the relevancy or the internal link structure and most importantly (e) the time to authority factor (like a fine wine aging over time) that represents the priceless / more elusive ranking factor to distill in reverse or from the perspective of a competitor to emulate.
